api/ASE.ISavableCanvas.html.title: Interface ISavableCanvas | JWestobyBOOSE
api/ASE.ISavableCanvas.html.summary: Interface ISavableCanvas Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Indicates that a canvas implementation can save its current bitmap to disk. Implementations should persist the visible canvas image to the provided file path. public interface ISavableCanvas Methods SaveCanvas(string) Save the current canvas contents to the specified file path. Implementations are responsible for choosing the image format and handling I/O errors. void SaveCanvas(string filePath) Parameters filePath string Destination file path where the canvas image will be saved.

api/ASE.IappInterface.html.title: Interface IappInterface | JWestobyBOOSE
api/ASE.IappInterface.html.summary: Interface IappInterface Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Extended application canvas interface that exposes floating-point drawing primitives in addition to the standard BOOSE.ICanvas operations. Implementors are expected to provide both integer- and float-based circle/rectangle methods. public interface IappInterface : ICanvas Inherited Members ICanvas.Set(int, int) ICanvas.SetColour(int, int, int) ICanvas.MoveTo(int, int) ICanvas.DrawTo(int, int) ICanvas.Clear() ICanvas.Reset() ICanvas.Circle(int, bool) ICanvas.Rect(int, int, bool) ICanvas.Tri(int, int) ICanvas.WriteText(string) ICanvas.getBitmap() ICanvas.Xpos ICanvas.Ypos ICanvas.PenColour Methods FCircle(float, bool) Draws a circle using a floating-point radius. The implementation decides how to map float coordinates to pixels. void FCircle(float radius, bool filled) Parameters radius float Radius of the circle in floating-point units. filled bool If true, the circle should be filled; otherwise draw an outline. FRect(float, float, bool) Draws a rectangle using floating-point width/height. The implementation decides how to map float dimensions to pixels. void FRect(float width, float height, bool filled) Parameters width float Rectangle width in floating-point units. height float Rectangle height in floating-point units. filled bool If true, the rectangle should be filled; otherwise draw an outline.

api/ASE.appArray.html.title: Class appArray | JWestobyBOOSE
api/ASE.appArray.html.summary: Class appArray Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Base implementation for array support in the ASE language. Provides compile-time parsing and runtime handling for both integer and real arrays, and helper routines used by concrete array commands (peek/poke). Responsibilities: Parse and validate array declarations (type, name, size) during Compile(). Allocate array storage on Execute(). Support reading and writing array elements through GetIntArray(int, int), GetRealArray(int, int), SetIntArray(int, int, int) and SetRealArray(double, int, int). Provide parameter processing helpers (ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool) and ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool)) used by peek/poke derived commands. Note: this class uses MessageBox calls to report user-visible errors to match the existing application's UX conventions. public class appArray : Evaluation, ICommand Inheritance object Command CheckParameters(string[]) Validates the raw parameter list for an array declaration. Shows a MessageBox if the token count is outside the expected range. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameterList) Parameters parameterList string[] Raw parameter text from the parser. Compile() Compile step for an array declaration. Parses declaration tokens (type, name, rows, optional columns). Validates parameter values and registers the array variable with the program. Reports invalid declarations via MessageBox. public override void Compile() Execute() Execute-time allocation of the array storage. Allocates either integer or real multidimensional arrays based on the declared type. Reports errors using MessageBox when the type is not recognised. public override void Execute() GetIntArray(int, int) Get an integer element from the backing integer array after validating indices. public virtual int GetIntArray(int row, int col) Parameters row int Row index. col int Column index. Returns int The integer value stored at the specified indices. GetRealArray(int, int) Get a real element from the backing real array after validating indices. public virtual double GetRealArray(int row, int col) Parameters row int Row index. col int Column index. Returns double The real value stored at the specified indices. ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool) Parse and prepare array operation parameters at compile time for peek/poke commands. The peekOrPoke flag selects which side of an assignment to treat as the value. Populates internal fields such as varName, rowS, columnS and pokeValue. Reports parameter or variable resolution errors using MessageBox. protected virtual void ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool peekOrPoke) Parameters peekOrPoke bool True when compiling a poke (write) command; false for peek (read). ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool) Evaluate and perform peek/poke operations at execution time. Resolves expressions for row/column/value where necessary. api/ASE.html.title: Namespace ASE | JWestobyBOOSE
api/ASE.html.summary: Namespace ASE Classes ASECanvas Concrete application canvas that implements both IappInterface and ISavableCanvas. Provides drawing primitives using GDI+ and maintains an internal bitmap for rendering. AppCommandFactory Factory that maps command names used by the ASE language to concrete BOOSE.ICommand implementations. The factory returns the appropriate command object given a canonical command type string. Ase_Form Main Windows Forms UI for the ASE application. Hosts the input textbox, execute/save buttons and a PictureBox used to display the canvas bitmap. Delegates execution and saving actions to ASE.Ase_Form.appBoose. NoCommand Placeholder command used for lines that should be ignored (for example comment markers). Implements the basic command lifecycle but performs no action during Compile or Execute. appAdapter Adapts an object that implements IappInterface so it can be used where an BOOSE.ICanvas is required. All calls are forwarded to the wrapped IappInterface instance. appArray Base implementation for array support in the ASE language. Provides compile-time parsing and runtime handling for both integer and real arrays, and helper routines used by concrete array commands (peek/poke). Responsibilities: Parse and validate array declarations (type, name, size) during Compile(). Allocate array storage on Execute(). Support reading and writing array elements through GetIntArray(int, int), GetRealArray(int, int), SetIntArray(int, int, int) and SetRealArray(double, int, int). Provide parameter processing helpers (ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool) and ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool)) used by peek/poke derived commands. Note: this class uses MessageBox calls to report user-visible errors to match the existing application's UX conventions. appBoose Facade and runtime coordinator for the ASE application. Manages the application canvas, command factory, parser and stored program. Exposes a minimal API used by the UI to run parsed programs and retrieve the canvas bitmap. This class implements a thread-safe lazy singleton via CreateInstance(). appInt Represents an integer variable/command in the ASE language. The class can register itself with a BOOSE.StoredProgram and updates the program value when executed. appParser Application-specific parser that converts a single line of ASE language into an BOOSE.ICommand. Extends the generic BOOSE.Parser to add ASE-specific preprocessing, comment handling and assignment resolution where the left-hand side references an existing variable. appPeek Implements the "peek" array command which reads a value from an existing array variable and assigns it into another variable. Parsing of the textual parameters, index evaluation and array access are delegated to the helper logic implemented on appArray. This command reports user-visible problems using MessageBox calls to match the existing application's UX. appPoke Implements the "poke" array command which writes a value into an existing array variable. Uses the array helper logic provided by appArray to parse parameters at compile time and to perform the write at runtime. appReal Represents a real (double) variable in the ASE language. Registers itself with the active BOOSE.StoredProgram during compilation and updates the stored program value when executed. The class exposes a real property that holds the double backing value. appStoredProgram Application-specific BOOSE.StoredProgram implementation. Responsibilities: Store and locate ASE variables. Maintain a separate double backing for appReal variables and update both backing and textual value when UpdateVariable(string, double) is called. Evaluate numeric expressions substituting real for real variables and BOOSE.Evaluation.Value for other variables before computing the result. appWrite Implements the "write" command which outputs text to the canvas. Execution order: Attempt to evaluate the parameter as an expression via the program. If the evaluation fails, treat the parameter as a variable name and write its value. Otherwise treat the parameter as a literal text string and write it. Interfaces ISavableCanvas Indicates that a canvas implementation can save its current bitmap to disk. Implementations should persist the visible canvas image to the provided file path. IappInterface Extended application canvas interface that exposes floating-point drawing primitives in addition to the standard BOOSE.ICanvas operations. Implementors are expected to provide both integer- and float-based circle/rectangle methods.

api/ase/ASE.appArray.html.summary: Class appArray Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Base implementation for array support in the ASE language. Provides compile-time parsing and runtime handling for both integer and real arrays, and helper routines used by concrete array commands (peek/poke). Responsibilities: Parse and validate array declarations (type, name, size) during Compile(). Allocate array storage on Execute(). Support reading and writing array elements through GetIntArray(int, int), GetRealArray(int, int), SetIntArray(int, int, int) and SetRealArray(double, int, int). Provide parameter processing helpers (ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool) and ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool)) used by peek/poke derived commands. Note: this class uses MessageBox calls to report user-visible errors to match the existing application's UX conventions. public class appArray : Evaluation, ICommand Inheritance object Command api/ase/ASE.appParser.html.summary: Class appParser Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Application-specific parser that converts a single line of ASE language into an BOOSE.ICommand. Extends the generic BOOSE.Parser to add ASE-specific preprocessing, comment handling and assignment resolution where the left-hand side references an existing variable. public class appParser : Parser, IParser Inheritance object Parser appParser Implements IParser Inherited Members Parser.ParseProgram(string) object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() Constructors appParser(AppCommandFactory, appStoredProgram) Initializes a new instance of appParser. public appParser(AppCommandFactory Factory, appStoredProgram Program) Parameters Factory AppCommandFactory Factory used to create command instances. Program appStoredProgram Program instance to associate with parsed commands. Methods ParseCommand(string) Parse a single textual command line into a concrete BOOSE.ICommand. Behavior: Lines beginning with a comment marker are converted to NoCommand. Preprocesses the line (normalises '*' tokens). Detects assignment syntax (e.g. "x = ...") and, if the left-hand side is an existing variable, rewrites the command so the variable's type-specific command (int/real) will be created and used. Uses the injected BOOSE.CommandFactory to create the command, calls Set(StoredProgram, string), and then BOOSE.ICommand.Compile(). public override ICommand ParseCommand(string line) Parameters line string Single line of ASE program text. api/ase/ASE.appReal.html.summary: Class appReal Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Represents a real (double) variable in the ASE language. Registers itself with the active BOOSE.StoredProgram during compilation and updates the stored program value when executed. The class exposes a real property that holds the double backing value. public sealed class appReal : Evaluation, ICommand Inheritance object Command Evaluation appReal Implements ICommand Inherited Members Evaluation.CheckParameters(string[]) Evaluation.ProcessExpression(string) Evaluation.Expression Evaluation.VarName Evaluation.Value Evaluation.Local Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.GetType() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() Constructors appReal() Default constructor required by the command factory and parser. public appReal() Properties real Gets or sets the underlying double value for this real variable. This property is used by appStoredProgram when evaluating expressions. public double real { get; set; } Property Value double Methods Compile() Compile step called by the parser. Registers this variable with the program. public override void Compile() Execute() Execute step for the real variable. Ensures the variable is registered with the program. Attempts to parse evaluatedExpression as a double or int and updates the program value. Shows a message box when the provided expression cannot be parsed as a real. public override void Execute()

api/ase/ASE.appWrite.html.title: Class appWrite | JWestobyBOOSE
api/ase/ASE.appWrite.html.summary: Class appWrite Namespace ASE Assembly ASE.dll Implements the "write" command which outputs text to the canvas. Execution order: Attempt to evaluate the parameter as an expression via the program. If the evaluation fails, treat the parameter as a variable name and write its value. Otherwise treat the parameter as a literal text string and write it. public class appWrite : CommandOneParameter, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter appWrite Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() Constructors appWrite() Default constructor used by the command factory and parser. public appWrite() appWrite(Canvas, string) Convenience constructor that accepts an initial text value. public appWrite(Canvas c, string text) Parameters c Canvas Canvas (unused in this overload). text string Text to write. Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Validates that exactly one parameter was provided. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameterList) Parameters parameterList string[] Execute() Execute the write command: If the parameter is an expression, write the evaluated result. Else if the parameter is a variable name, write the variable value. Otherwise write the literal parameter text. public override void Execute()

api/ase/ASE.html.title: Namespace ASE | JWestobyBOOSE
api/ase/ASE.html.summary: Namespace ASE Classes ASECanvas Concrete application canvas that implements both IappInterface and ISavableCanvas. Provides drawing primitives using GDI+ and maintains an internal bitmap for rendering. AppCommandFactory Factory that maps command names used by the ASE language to concrete BOOSE.ICommand implementations. The factory returns the appropriate command object given a canonical command type string. Ase_Form Main Windows Forms UI for the ASE application. Hosts the input textbox, execute/save buttons and a PictureBox used to display the canvas bitmap. Delegates execution and saving actions to ASE.Ase_Form.appBoose. NoCommand Placeholder command used for lines that should be ignored (for example comment markers). Implements the basic command lifecycle but performs no action during Compile or Execute. appAdapter Adapts an object that implements IappInterface so it can be used where an BOOSE.ICanvas is required. All calls are forwarded to the wrapped IappInterface instance. appArray Base implementation for array support in the ASE language. Provides compile-time parsing and runtime handling for both integer and real arrays, and helper routines used by concrete array commands (peek/poke). Responsibilities: Parse and validate array declarations (type, name, size) during Compile(). Allocate array storage on Execute(). Support reading and writing array elements through GetIntArray(int, int), GetRealArray(int, int), SetIntArray(int, int, int) and SetRealArray(double, int, int). Provide parameter processing helpers (ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool) and ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool)) used by peek/poke derived commands. Note: this class uses MessageBox calls to report user-visible errors to match the existing application's UX conventions. appBoose Facade and runtime coordinator for the ASE application. Manages the application canvas, command factory, parser and stored program. Exposes a minimal API used by the UI to run parsed programs and retrieve the canvas bitmap. This class implements a thread-safe lazy singleton via CreateInstance(). appInt Represents an integer variable/command in the ASE language. The class can register itself with a BOOSE.StoredProgram and updates the program value when executed. appParser Application-specific parser that converts a single line of ASE language into an BOOSE.ICommand. Extends the generic BOOSE.Parser to add ASE-specific preprocessing, comment handling and assignment resolution where the left-hand side references an existing variable. appPeek Implements the "peek" array command which reads a value from an existing array variable and assigns it into another variable. Parsing of the textual parameters, index evaluation and array access are delegated to the helper logic implemented on appArray. This command reports user-visible problems using MessageBox calls to match the existing application's UX. appPoke Implements the "poke" array command which writes a value into an existing array variable. Uses the array helper logic provided by appArray to parse parameters at compile time and to perform the write at runtime. appReal Represents a real (double) variable in the ASE language. Registers itself with the active BOOSE.StoredProgram during compilation and updates the stored program value when executed. The class exposes a real property that holds the double backing value. appStoredProgram Application-specific BOOSE.StoredProgram implementation. Responsibilities: Store and locate ASE variables. Maintain a separate double backing for appReal variables and update both backing and textual value when UpdateVariable(string, double) is called. Evaluate numeric expressions substituting real for real variables and BOOSE.Evaluation.Value for other variables before computing the result. appWrite Implements the "write" command which outputs text to the canvas. Execution order: Attempt to evaluate the parameter as an expression via the program. If the evaluation fails, treat the parameter as a variable name and write its value. Otherwise treat the parameter as a literal text string and write it. Interfaces ISavableCanvas Indicates that a canvas implementation can save its current bitmap to disk. Implementations should persist the visible canvas image to the provided file path. IappInterface Extended application canvas interface that exposes floating-point drawing primitives in addition to the standard BOOSE.ICanvas operations. Implementors are expected to provide both integer- and float-based circle/rectangle methods.

api/aseunittest/ASEUnitTest.arrayTest.ht.summary: Class arrayTest Namespace ASEUnitTest Assembly ASEUnitTest.dll Unit tests for appArray. Exercises allocation, element read/write and bounds-checking behaviour for both integer and real arrays. Tests use reflection helpers to set protected fields on the BOOSE.Evaluation base so the command can be exercised outside of the normal parser/compile flow.
